programme.title: Magnum P.I.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Higgins is in a complicated situation when 12-year-old Ella asks for help cracking a triple homicide that involves her mother; Magnum bonds with a terminally ill veteran while volunteering with the No Veteran Dies Alone Program.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum goes to extreme lengths to uncover the truth about a crime that may have involved his dear deceased friend.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: A man wakes up on a beach covered in blood, so he hires Magnum and Higgins to investigate a crime he doesn't remember; T.C. is taken aback when Cade's biological grandmother makes a surprise visit; Rick's feelings for Suzy grow stronger.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins are sent on a deadly mission inside a high security correctional center when a ruthless criminal abducts Katsumoto and his ex-wife; T.C. rushes to help Rick when Suzy experiences serious pregnancy complications.

programme.title: Magnum P.I.
programme.desc: Magnum and Higgins weigh the risks of pursuing a relationship; Rick juggles being a new father and running La Mariana; Katsumoto tries to figure out his next move.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman hires Nick and Sylvie to find her mother who abandoned her 20 years ago. They track her down to a clinic that offers psychiatric treatment, where Nick and Sylvie pose as a couple to join the therapy group.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A businessman hires Nick to protect him from his wife who he believes is trying to kill him.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A candidate for Governor hires Nick and Sylvie to investigate the accusations that his son raped a woman.

programme.title: Tropical Heat

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: Brennan and Booth investigate the college-basketball world to determine who is responsible for the murder of a player on a nationally ranked team.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: After a woman's car is run off the road, only her baby survives; Booth and Brennan go to the woman's hometown to investigate.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: When Max (Ryan O'Neal) goes on trial for the murder of FBI Deputy Director Robert Kirby, all the team members but Brennan are called as expert witnesses for the prosecution.

programme.title: Bones
programme.desc: An aspiring singer (Ace Young) is murdered and, as Brennan and Booth investigate the musician's fans and foes, one obsessed woman transfers her affections to Booth.

programme.desc: The squad reels from the fallout of Capt. Cragen being arrested for the murder of an escort.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The investigation into Capt. Cragen and two warring escort services continues; Brian Cassidy's undercover work becomes increasingly difficult; Amaro struggles with the case and his marriage.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A famous TV host (Roger Bart) forces himself on the young author (Anna Chlumsky) of an erotic novel; Detective Amaro uncovers a secret that could damage the author's career and her case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The special victims squad tries to take down a sex-trafficking operation that enslaves young women; when the investigation is halted by Lt. Alexandra Eames (Kathryn Erbe), Detective Benson has to get creative.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The kidnapping of a young boy reminds Cragen, Munch and Benson of an unsolved case from 13 years earlier.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The investigation into a girl's disappearance leads to a high-tech kidnapper who uses the Internet to cover his tracks; Rollins reconnects with her sister.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a woman claims that the baby she kidnapped is hers with a respected legal expert, the investigation changes the lives of two families.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: As the detectives investigate reports of sexual abuse at an elite private school, decades of secrets are exposed.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A man goes on a killing spree, but he has links to a prostitute that Benson encountered in an earlier investigation, so the FBI contacts SVU for information.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Holiday celebrations are interrupted when Detective Tutuola's ex-brother-in-law is arrested for attacking a priest; during the investigation, a church scandal is uncovered.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a rape victim is arrested for murder in Suffolk County, Detective Benson questions the case and finds enough evidence for District Attorney Barba to charge a different suspect in Manhattan.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives go under cover to arrest a man who brutally attacks other men; a deceptively tough defense attorney (Nia Vardalos) complicates ADA Barba's case.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a janitor violently attacks a coach, the SVU team connects the janitor's behavior to a history of sexual abuse; the detectives find more victims of the same predator -- including a prisoner (Mike Tyson) on death row.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: FBI Agent Dana Lewis partners with SVU when she thinks a 25-year-old rape-murder case in New York is connected to multiple unsolved cases across the country; as Lewis doggedly pursues her suspect, Benson and Amaro question his guilt.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The SVU squad tries to keep Detective Rollins' sister safe from her abusive boyfriend when she turns up beaten and pregnant; when Rollins is forced to take drastic action, an internal affairs investigation begins.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A promising singer is beaten by her boyfriend, a famous hip-hop star, but she refuses to help ADA Barba build his case; the defendant and his attorney turn the case into a media circus.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries

programme.desc: The world is full of stunning displays of natural phenomena that are so spectacular and, at times, so strange they defy conventional wisdom; examining if science can explain these mysteries.

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.desc: Many people are afraid of walking into a cursed place or touching a reportedly cursed object; looking at if whether or not curses are real and how are they brought into existence.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Despite their hippie persona and rustic community businesses, the Twelve Tribes have long stood accused of physically abusing children and subjugating of women.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Growing up in the United Nation of Islam (UNOI), Elijah Muhammad was forced into child labor, physical abuse and squalid living conditions. Today, he has a unique opportunity to speak to the FBI in hope of getting justice for himself and the other children abused by UNOI and its leader, Royall Jenkins', teachings.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Amy Bril recounts her childhood growing up in the Children of God, a group notorious for pedophilia and "religious" prostitution.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Former "Moonie," Teddy Hose, tries to alert the public to a gun-obsessed Unification Church offshoot known as The Sanctuary Church of Newfoundland, PA.

programme.title: Killer Kids
programme.desc: An 8-year-old vanishes without a trace; a teen is set up and slaughtered to death by his friends.

programme.title: Killer Kids

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: All the Concept Corvette's elements are built and assembled, but Dave needs to find a buyer; a rock 'n' roll icon brings his '34 Ford coupe to the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repaint of a 1964 Corvette careens into much more after Dave upsells the client on a couple of design features, and the crew finds some damage underneath the original paint; the owner of an iconic Ford GTX1 tasks Dave with solving a dilemma.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An abandoned 1967 C10 that has been sitting for years has been sold to a client who wants a few new touches, but closer inspection reveals more work is needed.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave convinces the client to make the 1967 C10 truck into a convertible; Kevin takes on a new personal project with a Cadillac Escalade.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The engineering on the convertible C10 works in theory, but making it work in practice is the next step; a team brings in a replica 1967 Cobra with a bad engine.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Of all the different years and generations of the VW Bug, there is one that stands out among the rest -- the Hebmüller; there are maybe 200 of them left, so in addition to being hard to find, they are truly the holy grail of VWs.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The build continues, and the challenge is to keep what makes the car a Hebmueller intact, while taking bold steps to turn it into a hot rod. Dave keeps the traditional two-tone exterior, but modifying it to an automatic is a huge test for the shop.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Normally when Kindig-It Design attends a car show, their cars are the ones being judged. But this time around, Dave and Kev hold the keys and will have to select the top 10 builders out of the hundreds of cars that arrive for the show.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave's clients have owned a car since they got married 25 years ago and want it restored so they can enjoy it for another 25. While the shop isn't really into straight restorations, adding some custom pieces and paint makes them "say yes" to the pro.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave is thrilled with the latest build, while KevDogg is barely lukewarm; Dave has done double-cab VWs, Bugs and Karmann Ghias, but now he is taking on something completely different, and even more rare.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Matching the two-tone paint job is the challenge of the day as the '53 Barn Door Deluxe build carries on; custom trim, a new, more powerful engine, 22 windows and a custom interior all come together to make this surprise worth the wait.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the guys at Kindig-It proved they could execute Dave's vision of his production Corvette, but now that a few have sold, they have to get them completely finished.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team put the finishing touches on the first-ever Kindig CF Corvettes to complete a lifelong dream; however, the clients argue about who will get the first one, all in advance of a once-in-a-lifetime debut at SEMA.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kevin, who have been an absolute treat for automotive enthusiasts for years, come back to the SEMA show with something special on their minds.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Beatles fanatic challenges Dave to paint a modern Rolls-Royce to match the car John Lennon commissioned in the late 1960s.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show as far east as they have ever gone and head to Lake George, New York, for the Adirondack Nationals; the town shuts down for the car show, attracting some of the best on the east coast.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1970s Pantera is an iconic sportscar, but once Dave gets his hands on it, the style will never be the same; the client has given Dave free rein to change the car as he sees fit, but has one request: he is 6'4" and can't comfortably get in it.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: With the whole team in agreement over the body mods, the crew must make the designs into reality; their list of tasks include bulging out the fenders, creating a spider-shaped exhaust, executing the stretch and getting the car to body.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Pantera is almost done, but nothing is simple with this car; Dave and Kev get a chance to upgrade their semi rig.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A 1971 Chevy Nova with tremendous pedigree arrives at the shop to get classic Kindig-It styling cues; Dave wants to make this car into a hardtop; tucked-in bumpers, front valance and a new engine provide a good test for the crew.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Will makes miracles happen, and Dave decides to make a wholesale change to the car's color; challenges mount at each stage of the build, and the upholstery shop changes up their routine as the client arrives for a reveal years in the making.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: While the shop perfects its process in building the CF1s, word about the car spreads and potential buyers line up; the latest client has a big problem when he can't choose the perfect color combination.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and Kev take the show to the Midwest, as more than 2,500 cars descend on the Summit Motorsports drag strip for a weekend of fun; Kev gets a ride in a lean, mean drag racing machine; Dave steps up his autocross game.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A client enlists Dave on a mission from God to make his dreams of a father/son road trip along Route 66 come true; getting the client's mechanically unsound reproduction of the Bluesmobile ready for the road will test the crew's mettle.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Kevin Schiele breathes new life into a semi-hauler by giving it a visual and functional upgrade that impeccably reflects his expertise in trucks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave finally realizes one of his dreams by opening the Kindig Academy.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the team determine that a '69 Camaro requires a full rebuild.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The Camaro build hits a snag as the crew tries to get the engine dialed in.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A simple repair turns into a full rebuild for a show-ready '35 Roadster.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop hits the road with their freshest builds for a show in Colorado.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The owner of an iconic '55 Nomad wants to boost the power with a blower.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Rick Mezich from "Deadliest Catch" tests Dave's design prowess on his CF1.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A Hummer comes in for a 4WD conversion, engine swap, interior and paint.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop has a busy week prepping for the 2022 SEMA show in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave makes modifications to the latest CF1 and announces a pinewood derby.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew gears up for the last car show of the year in Scottsdale, Arizona.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A beat-up truck arrives, but underneath all the rust lies a hidden gem.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The body work on the C10 is where the art of the build truly comes out.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Challenges still lie ahead as the C10 moves into final assembly.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew tests the effects of running long vs. short rods on otherwise identical engines; they'll find out if long rods make more torque, if shorter rods' faster swipe makes a difference, or if rod length doesn't actually matter.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out which cheap carburetors produce the most expensive results; they pick a fight among remanufactured offerings from Edelbrock, Summit and Demon to see which will pump the most power into their 383 Chevrolet.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys flip things upside down to find out how much power might be left in the oil pan; a number of factors play a part in minimizing turbulence around the crank, but an $1,100 solution may not be worth the cost.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys flip things upside down to find out how much power might be left in the oil pan; a number of factors play a part in minimizing turbulence around the crank, but an $1,100 solution may not be worth the cost.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to shed light on whether iron or aluminum heads will deliver more power; they'll look at weight savings and heat retention's effect on cylinder pressure.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A camshaft is causing issues, so the crew explores how changes to cam timing can help tune a power curve for high-end performance or low-end power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys experiment with lash adjustments in an effort unleash more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether a dual or a single exhaust system has more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys answer the question of whether a carb spacer produces more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys do a 4/7 swap on a big 572 to see if there's more power to be had.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys compare four of the most popular intake manifolds on the market.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys take 555 BBC and the Blower Shop then test the difference in power between gas and e85.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys dive into the lobe separation angle of the camshaft.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore the gains to be found for a sickly, low-compression 440.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys go through the basics of bringing a motor to the dyno cell.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew asks whether it's worth it to upgrade an ignition system.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore how header collector length affects power output.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys follow Freiburger's personal quest for 1,000 NA horsepower.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew investigates just how much power gets sacrificed to look cool.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see if lightweight rotating assembly parts help make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test three sets of headers on a power-boosted motor.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether tunnel-ram or cross-ram setups make more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys see which muffler works best for street-driving 1,000 HP monsters.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys break down two very different engines that make similar numbers.

programme.title: Through the Storm
programme.desc: Follows the 2023 season of the Red Lake Nation (Ojibwe) high school football team. Despite dwindling interest and a two-decade-long losing record, a determined coach and group of young athletes fight to keep their football program alive. An exploration in overcoming loss, the film follows the personal triumphs and hardships of the players and their families, and how football serves as a symbol of hope, unity, and resilience for the people of Red Lake.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: "Down one in the 11th, Ken Griffey Jr. scored from first on a Edgar Martinez double to win the ALDS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The American League and National league face off in a pitching duel for four innings of the 1980 All-Star Game until Fred Lynn crushes a two-run homer. The NL would take the lead for good in the 6th.

programme.title: All-Star Highlights
programme.desc: Take a look at highlights from the first MLB All-Star Game played in San Diego in 1978. Rod Carew's two triples set an All-Star Game record, but the National League prevailed, winning 7-3.

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: Yankees infielder Aaron Boone creates one of the most memorable moments in the rivalry between the Yankees and Red Sox in the 2003 ALCS.

programme.title: MLB Network Countdown

programme.title: Baseball's Seasons
programme.desc: 1968 was the year of the pitcher. Bob Gibson set a modern-day record with a 1.12 ERA, while the Tigers had two pitchers with historic seasons. Denny McLain won 31 games during the regular season and Mickey Lolich had three wins in the World Series.

programme.title: Epic Innings
programme.desc: Look back at epic baseball moments from 1990-1994, including 43-year-old Nolan Ryan earning his sixth no-hitter, Joe Carter's incredible World Series winner, and more.

programme.title: World Series Film
programme.desc: In a historic victory, the Yankees secure their 27th World Series title, propelled by Hideki Matsui's legendary performance. His six runs driven in, a World Series record, almost single handedly beat the Phillies, propelling New York to a 7-3 win.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Future Hall of Famer Roy Halladay throws a historic no-hitter in his first postseason appearance in the 2010 NLDS.

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: Mark Teixeira hits a walk-off homer in the 11th inning to help the Yankees win Game 2 of the ALDS.

programme.title: Great Games

programme.title: Great Games
programme.desc: The Yankees hit three homers, highlighted by Judge's first postseason jack, to advance to the ALDS.

programme.title: Great Games

programme.title: Epic Moments
programme.desc: In one of the greatest single-game World Series performances of all-time, Pablo Sandoval gets the Giants off and running with a three-homer game in Game 1 against the Tigers.

Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. programme.title: El Condor
programme.desc: After escaping from a chain gang, Luke (Jim Brown) partners with tough prospector Jaroo (Lee Van Cleef) to search for gold in a Mexican fort. The enterprising duo manage to convince Apache chief Santana (Iron Eyes Cody) and his tribe to help them infiltrate the fort, which is defended by Mexican military officer Chavez (Patrick O'Neal) and his men. While things don't go according to plan, Chavez's lover, Claudine (Mariana Hill), falls for Luke, which proves helpful to the scrappy bandits.

programme.title: The Train Robbers
programme.desc: After the death of her husband, Mrs. Lowe (Ann-Margret) posts a $50,000 reward in return for help recovering her train-robber beau's hidden fortune, under the pretense of returning it. Lane (John Wayne) assembles a group of cowboys to head to Mexico with Mrs. Lowe, enticed by the reward money. As they cross into Mexico, however, they realize they're being followed, by both a posse of bandits and a single mysterious rider (Ricardo Montalban) with his own agenda.

programme.title: The Searchers
programme.desc: In this revered Western, Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) returns home to Texas after the Civil War. When members of his brother's family are killed or abducted by Comanches, he vows to track down his surviving relatives and bring them home. Eventually, Edwards gets word that his niece Debbie (Natalie Wood) is alive, and, along with her adopted brother, Martin Pawley (Jeffrey Hunter), he embarks on a dangerous mission to find her, journeying deep into Comanche territory.

programme.title: Angel and the Badman

Before long, Burdette's brother, Nathan (John Russell), comes around, indicating that he's prepared to bust his brother out of jail if necessary. Chance decides to make a stand until reinforcements arrive, enlisting Dude, an old cripple named Stumpy (Walter Brennan) and baby-faced cowboy Colorado Ryan (Ricky Nelson) to help.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: A Bell Family Christmas
programme.desc: Secrets come to light as the Bell family celebrates Christmas in their new home in this story of family, friendship, faith, and forgiveness.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Headed South for Christmas
programme.desc: An angst-ridden teen longs to meet the mother who died during her birth, as her dad takes her to spend Christmas with relatives they barely know.

programme.title: A Frosty Affair
programme.desc: An unexpected road trip during a blizzard with a stranger to make her wedding forces a small-town teacher to take a hard look at her life choices.

programme.title: A Raunchy Christmas Story
programme.desc: Friends throw a secluded holiday bash to put romance back into a friend's life, unaware that an investigative reporter and a Russian spy are guests.

programme.title: Christmas Casanova
programme.desc: Podcaster Elise partners with Daniyal to create an unforgettable Christmas, but it seems he's wooing the wrong woman amidst the festive chaos.

programme.title: Vineyard Christmas, A
programme.desc: The host of Read Between the Vines envisions her perfect Christmas episode at a unique local winery whose stubborn owner wants nothing to do with it.

programme.title: A Very English Christmas
programme.desc: A woman coordinates her half-sister's Christmas Eve whirlwind wedding in the English countryside with the help of a handsome market owner.

programme.title: Coupled Up for Christmas
programme.desc: Hoping to reunite with her longtime crush, Tiffany joins forces with heartbroken Peter in order to win back the hearts of their respective soulmates.

programme.title: Fabric of Christmas, The
programme.desc: When a fireman and a quilting teacher’s burgeoning romance is threatened, they must decide what is truly important in time for the holiday season.

programme.title: Christmas by Candlelight
programme.desc: A cynical candle maker agrees to help an ambitious wellness expert develop a line of Christmas scents in order to fulfill his daughter's holiday wish.

programme.title: Christmas in Scotland
programme.desc: A designer and wealthy heir must team up to bring holiday magic to a small community, making both realize they wish to spend every Christmas together.

programme.title: Waking Up to Christmas
programme.desc: After being zapped by faulty Christmas lights, a workaholic finds herself the lead in an over-the-top Hallmark-style holiday movie.

programme.title: Christmas on the Slopes

programme.title: Anything but Christmas
programme.desc: When a lawmaker proposes changing the Christmas holiday's name to something more inclusive, an elf steps in to stop the vote on the bill.

programme.title: Christmas With Cookie: Locked Away
programme.desc: In the year 3000, an obnoxiously funny elf has just landed on the moon. He spends his first night eating cookies and reading a story about zombies.

programme.title: The Key to Christmas
programme.desc: When a rebel elf reverses time at the North Pole and turns Santa Claus into a teenager, it’s up to a little girl with a magic key to save Christmas.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to the Miners Arms in Nenthead, Cumbria, where sisters Alison Baker and Lynda Clark hope to impress their guests with their eco credentials.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Brothers Andrew and James Widdas run the Rose and Crown in Edgworth, near Bolton. Their dream is to provide boutique on a budget, but they only have eight months of experience, and B&B veterans Alison and Lynda are quick to find fault.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Nigel and Pok U Regan cultivate an east-meets-west atmosphere at their B&B and Cantonese restaurant, the Bingham Townhouse in Nottinghamshire.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Float by Boat, near Rugby, partners Kev Argent and Tor Johnson run mediation and mindfulness breaks from their narrowboat, Spirited Away.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Filey, North Yorkshire, at The White Lodge Hotel, where hosts James and Kim Hodgson hope their love of luxury and high standards will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Crystals on The Prom in Blackpool, where Amanda Lucia-Charley, joined by friend Alan Talbot, hopes her unique and theatrical design decisions will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's third visit is to The Red Lion Country Inn in Upper Poppleton, North Yorkshire, where practical pair Mark and Jean Lee hope their plain and simple pub B&B will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is glamping site Camp Katur in Kirklington, where Kerry Roy and Nicola Wilding hope to wow the guests with their unique `geodomes' and see through pods.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Farmyard Inn in Youlgrave, in the Peak District, where manager Susan Day is joined by her best friend Andrea Scott.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Stoneleigh B&B in Trowbridge, where ex-teachers Meg and Andy Slade invite the guests into their family home.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit, the competition heads to Whittlesey, Peterborough, and The Falcon Hotel, where Colin and Michelle Wilson hope their no frills pub will impress.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Finishing off the competition is Grimscote Manor Hotel in Birmingham, owned by business partners Steve Cuddy and Gill Etheridge, who aim to bring elegant sophistication to the hospitality trade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Cholmeley Arms in Burton-le-Coggles, Lincolnshire, run by chef John Berry and his wife Lesley.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Islington Mill B&B in Salford, where Joe Spencer and Louise Woodcock have an alternative hosting style as their drag alter egos: Joyce De Vision and Trish Dee.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit this week is to Pebbles B&B in Seaton, Devon, where host Peter Morris opened his family home to guests eight months ago.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the Tarr Farm Inn on Exmoor, where Hilary Lester rules the roost with assistant manager Stacey Wade.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit is to the Bridge Hotel in Scunthorpe with new owners Martin and Hannah Weaver. On arrival, Rob and Michelle Earp from Seashells B&B in Sutton-on-Sea find a condom by the entrance, and Clare Davies and Fran Hancock from The New Court Hotel in Usk have concerns over interior cleanliness. Tom Jones and Samara Cohen from The Crown at Whitchurch judge the rooms to be little more than functional.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group stay at Sue's dog friendly Seashells Guesthouse in Great Yarmouth no one knows quite what to expect.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to East Linton in Scotland and the Crown and Kitchen.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The New Court Hotel in Usk, where manager Clare Davies is joined in the competition by the pub owner's mother, Fran Hancock. On arrival, Tom and Samara are impressed, but Martin and Hannah find lots of cleanliness issues. At dinner, there are tensions as the group discuss who would take which role if they were to run a B&B together. Breakfast is cooked by Clare, but peppery eggs and missing mushrooms cause concern.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at The Admiral Hotel in central London, run by owner So Shaw and hotel manager Kevin Jankunas.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Redstone in Blackpool, where high-end hotelier Ursula Beswick and manager Daria Pakalnicka hope their luxury guest house will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Ann's Farmhouse in Thornton, Yorkshire, owned by Chris Foster, who's assisted by his good friend, Christel Richter.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The R Inn in Desborough, owned by Kris Malde, who's helped out by events manager Vikki Cheetham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Stockton Mill B&B in Shropshire, where Stephen and Caroline Cox hope to provide a home from home for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Duxford Lodge in Cambridgeshire, run by ex-phone salesman Kevin Patel. He's hoping to turn his family-owned hotel into a 1940s inspired B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Riverside House Hotel in Mildenhall, where experienced hoteliers Ged Sharrocks and Suzanne Law offer a full hotel experience helped by their staff.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Last to host are Stacey Walsham and Gemma Dyche from The Gate Hangs High in Hook Norton, Oxfordshire, where they hope their dog-friendly accommodation will go down a treat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Hampshire, at The Poacher Inn, where manager Nadia Schicci hopes her Italian directness and business approach will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Forest Country House in Powys, Wales, where owner Paul Martin, joined by best friend and neighbour, Jayne Kirk, hopes his luxury BandB will impress his guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to Fenwick, Scotland and Langside Bed and Breakfast, where high rolling, super clean hosts Debbie and Jim hope their business will wow the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the historic The Tushielaw Inn in Selkirk, Scotland, opened by Rab and Gail Forbes six months ago. Gail and Rab try to build bridges, but things take a downward turn.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in The Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by friend and fellow B&B owner, Jeronime Palmer.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second hosts of the week are mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson from the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, run by Julie Dunbar and James Graham. Some guests are impressed, but luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime are left wanting more.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Townhead Hotel in Lockerbie, owned by Stephen Montgomery and partner Jan. On arrival, the high level of finish in the rooms is a surprise for all of the guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: In Stratford upon Avon at The Water's Edge Guest House, owner Julie Allison and friend Gerry Crabtree hope their luxurious approach and themed rooms will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the Kilpeck Inn in Herefordshire where head chef Ross Williams and front of house manager Kath Capel consider no detail too small.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third stop is The Fox Inn in Guisborough where young hosts Michael Crane and Jai Bennison are determined to impress their guests with their straight-forward northern B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Ivanhoe Guest House, Bridlington, Mick and Gill Jennings think their simple approach will win the day. But at breakfast some serious allegations are made about the food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Falmouth in Cornwall, where Gaye Woods, owner of Meudon Hotel, hopes her family run hotel will win the day, but are her room rates too high?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Malborough in Devon and The Royal Oak pub, run by Tim Heap with help from his barman Mikey Martindale. Following some unwanted extras at breakfast, feedback is tough.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is in Tiverton in Devon and The Angel Guest House where owners Chris and Sue Holliday have created a homespun experience, but will they prove too competitive for the guests?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes, Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub BandB is the right fit for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, where owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the BandBers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to yurt glamp-site, Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the BandBers buy into their woodland retreat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team, Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, where managers and best friends, Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks, pride themselves on being the `queens of clean'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet friendly Dog in a Doublet pub and restaurant in Peterborough where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&Bers head to the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, Devon, where Europhiles Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Maldon, Essex and The White Horse Inn, where hospitality expert Jayne and her husband, Pete Kocinoga, hope their attention to detail will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and her toy boy husband Paul Harman. Here, as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to The Black Swan Inn in Pickering, Yorkshire, where Phil and Jill have spent large sums to bring their 18th century inn up to their exacting standards.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Delamere Farm in Northborough, where owner Agi Chapman, who is joined by Jayne Thorpe Godman, prides herself on providing a luxurious sleep to all her visitors.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Harrogate where management team Chris `Clarky' Clarke and Katie Light help run the White Hart Hotel. The guests meet some llamas and the extra charge for fancy coffee causes a stir.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to New Promenade Hotel in Blackpool, owned by Raouf, who is joined by friend Chrissie. There's a teetering toilet seat and Clarky and Katie find muck on the taps.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Vicky's small terraced house, aptly named The Terrace, in Oxford. On inspection, two pairs of guests discover an array of filthy finds, including a pre-sucked sweet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Robin and Liza's Georgian mansion Tall John's House in the Brecon Beacons. At dinner the guests gush over their new friendships but Vicky doesn't share their feelings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit sees Sam and Henry confident that their five-star rooms above a quintessential English country pub, The Bear and Swan, in Chew Magna, Somerset, will impress their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Guesthouse East in Eastbourne, where childhood sweethearts Tony and Lisa hope their guests will fall head over heels for their family friendly B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to the Shirley B&B in Bournemouth, where Jorge Mesquita hopes to impress his guests with his all-round cleanliness and the power of his showers.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Peacock, monster, unicorn, deer and lion take the stage for their second performances; Joel McHale joins as a guest panelist.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Rabbit, alien, raven, poodle and bee each take the stage to perform a second time; Joel McHale joins as a guest panelist.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The ultimate guessing game kicks off with the first six undercover celebrity singers – PEACOCK, HIPPO, MONSTER, UNICORN, DEER and LION – facing off against one another in elaborate head-to-toe costumes. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke as they attempt to guess WHO is the performer behind the mask. Between all twelve of the celebrity competitors on the show, they’ve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. One singer will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity. Hear them sing, get the clues and guess the celebrity.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Dirty Balls, The Wall Swing, The Crusher, Crazy Beams and Big Donuts are among some of the over-the-top obstacles included in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Amanda Byram assists Richard from the sidelines as contestants take on a challenge called like The Qualifier.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Some of the obstacles the contestants face are the “Bouncy Balls” and “The Sweeper”.

programme.desc: Steve Jones hosts the series where contestants are ejected in the most nerve-wracking means ever seen on TV.

programme.desc: The Winter Blob makes a welcome appearance to send the contestants into orbit whilst Granny’s House.

programme.desc: Tonight, twenty brave battlers will take on the wintry weirdness.

programme.desc: Twenty brave Brits have volunteered for an expedition to the arctic wastelands of Argentina.

programme.desc: Richard and co-host Amanda return with new obstacles, new contestants and LOTS of falling in this episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: This week contestants on Wipeout Australia are bought undone by a seemingly simple obstacle on the Qualifier, the Slippery Stairs. It’s all in the name really, an innocent set of stairs, covered in Wipeout Crash cream. Its up the way and down the way for all and sundry. The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. Look out for Scotty Six Toes at the Big Balls and get the ear plugs ready as you meet Herr Chris. It’s a colourful week with leotards, laughs and lots of ladies.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Mesmerized by Bon Bon’s Belly Dancing, we catch up with our favourite Big Balls in the Qualifier. They dish out punishment to Australia’s very own female Jim Carrey and send Big Cat tamer Robbie into the pond. Goofy Goggles up the ante on the Dreadmill causing the Breakdancing Dad to create hilarious new moves. Golden Guns, Marisa battles it out for the ladies against Perfect Specimen, Seamus in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows. This week we are forced to take notice of Demolition Dave, a 49 yr old South Australia man who thanks to some home training smashes the qualifier. For those lucky enough to survive the Fly Screen Sweeper it was Dizzy Dummy time. Emerging as the Dark Horse, Kobie Mulligan earned herself a shot in the Wipeout Zone, joined by a Strategist and Rubber Woman resulting in a bitter showdown.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: 20 Greatest Hits

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In this week’s challenge, the Mystery Box is back and the chefs must individually face the challenge of preparing a gourmet meal out of army rations.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining nine home cooks are tasked with firing up their grills and preparing a restaurant quality barbecue plate that is guaranteed to impress the judges.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough elimination challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks face their next task when the judges test their senses in a blind taste challenge. Each contestant will blindly taste a dish prepared by Gordon Ramsay and then must recreate the dish. The contestant with the dish that best reflects Gordon’s dish will receive a significant advantage. In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will prepare VIP dishes for a dining room of all grandmothers for their first restaurant challenge. Each team will create a unique dish of “new” ingredients and the team with the most votes will be safe from elimination. Find out who will move on to the Top 10 and who will leave.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbook’s signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E10 - Semi Final 2

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E11 - Final

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E03 - The F Word

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E04 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon last left Laurence knowing that he had simplified his menu to have clean, simple, honest, traditional food using local produce. Surely this was enough to bring back the locals and win back the faith of the ex-pats.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: With landlord Brian's continual stress and interference in the kitchen, which Gordon believed was one of the main reasons for the inefficiencies of The Fenwick Arms, and now the added pressure of new competition, it's no wonder the pub is in trouble. Gordon's not going to like what's happened in his absence.

programme.desc: With landlord Brian's continual stress and interference in the kitchen, which Gordon believed was one of the main reasons for the inefficiencies of The Fenwick Arms, and now the added pressure of new competition, it's no wonder the pub is in trouble. Gordon's not going to like what's happened in his absence.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E01 - Italian

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E02 - Indian

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for £300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing £5,000 a week.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E05 - The F Word

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E06 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and décor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the Wales chefs: returning contenders Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry. All are determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. Stephen Terry cooks `The Opening Ceremony', Richard Davies makes ravioli of quail, parfait of foie gras, roasted salsify and Madeira jelly, and James Sommerin cooks sage cream, onion, chicken and Welsh `Brie' truffle toast.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry are all determined to knock out their rivals in the race to the banquet. They cook their fish course, but which one will prevail? Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Fish and Shellfish Medley', Richard Davies with compression of vine tomato, poached lobster and hand dived scallop, or James Sommerin with lobster and Iberico ham, spiced butter and broccoli?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their main course, but only one chef will take gold. Will it be Stephen Terry with `The Bunny Pentathlon', Richard Davies with slow cooked rib of beef, beetroot ketchup, bone marrow and braised shallot, or James Sommerin with mangalitsa pork, carrot, liquorice and leek?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Stephen Terry cook their dessert, but who will impress? Stephen Terry with `Bronze, Silver or Gold?', Richard Davies with passion fruit cream and gel with bitter chocolate sorbet or James Sommerin with raspberry and lemon cheesecake? `Great British Menu' veteran Angela Hartnett decides who goes through to the judges on Friday and who is going home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is decision time for the chefs from Wales. The two remaining chefs cook their entire menus for judges Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: South West contenders Paul Ainsworth and Nathan Outlaw, plus newcomer Simon Hulstone, kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be Paul with his `Breakfast of Champions'; Nathan with hogs pudding with seaweed, potato terrine and mushroom ketchup; or Simon Hulstone with track and field - beetroot and goats cheese?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs cook their fish course, but which one but which one will prevail? Will it be Paul Ainsworth with monkfish `Two Showings'; Nathan Outlaw with mackerel, horseradish and oyster sauce; or Simon Hulstone with `The Swimming Pool'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the chefs' final chance to impress the veteran with their dessert dishes. Will it be Paul Ainsworth with `Then and Now'; Nathan Outlaw with elderflower and lemon tart, with strawberry sorbet and meringues; or Simon Hulstone with `Closing Ceremony'?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's decision time on Great British Menu for the chefs from the South West region. One chef left the competition on the previous day and only two remain to cook their entire menus for the `Great British Menu' judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton. The judges aren't easily pleased and only world class cooking will do.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The 2012 competition enters its final week. The winners of the regional heats compete for a chance for their dish to be on the final banquet menu at a prestigious event hosted by Sir Steve Redgrave with a glittering guest list of British Olympians. Here, the finalists cook their starters, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Richard Corrigan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The eight winners of the regional heats prepare to cook their fish dishes, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Marcus Wareing. Before they get into the kitchen, they must first learn whether they will all be cooking.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: On day three, the chosen finalists cook their main courses, which will be tasted and scored by the `Great British Menu' judges and veteran judge Tom Kerridge.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's desserts day in the finals, and the last chance for the competing chefs to impress the judges and veteran Angela Hartnett. After a hard-fought week, the end of this programme will see the judges finally reveal the winning four dishes which will make up this year's `Great British Menu'.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This final programme follows the successful chefs in the run-up to the Olympic banquet at the Old Royal Naval College in Greenwich, as they make the painstaking preparations for what is one of the most important meals they will ever cook. The four winning chefs prepare an outstanding four-course menu for a truly Olympian guest list.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nation’s gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty Don meets Dick and Pauline Beijen, who moved from Dick's native Holland to a 44 acre plot in Devon.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Rob and Sue Wood moved from London to Cornwall to live a more self-sufficient life.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill reveals some exciting news. After years of dreaming, she finally has her very own garden and can't wait to share her plans and get to grips with bringing this compact space to life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the dry garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet a group of volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden, and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardeners' World comes from the first big flower show of the season: the RHS Malvern Spring Festival. Arit Anderson and Joe Swift discover the newest varieties of plants and flowers that are hot off the potting bench.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy planting out tropical gingers and sweetcorn and direct sowing beans. Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, and Rekha Mistry shares the secrets of growing aubergines.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.
